text: The 1777 English cricket season was the sixth in which matches have been awarded retrospective first-class cricket status. The scorecards of six first- class matches have survived. James Aylward made a record score of 167 runs that stood until 1820. ==Matches== Six first-class match scorecards survive from 1777, all of them involving Hampshire XIs playing England sides.Association of Cricket Statisticians and Historians (ACS) (1981) A Guide to Important Cricket Matches Played in the British Isles 1709 – 1863. Nottingham: ACS.Results, English Domestic Season 1777, CricInfo. Retrieved 2019-02-17. *18–20 June - England v Hampshire XI - Sevenoaks VineEngland v Hampshire XI, scorecard, CricInfo. Retrieved 2019-02-18. *7–10 July - Hampshire XI v England - Broadhalfpenny DownHampshire XI v England, scorecard, CricInfo. Retrieved 2019-02-18. *22–26 July - England v Hampshire XI - Laleham BurwayEngland v Hampshire XI, scorecard, CricInfo. Retrieved 2019-02-18. *18–20 August - England v Hampshire XI - Guildford BasonEngland v Hampshire XI, scorecard, CricInfo. Retrieved 2019-02-18. *8–10 September - Hampshire XI v England - Broadhalfpenny DownHampshire XI v England, scorecard, CricInfo. Retrieved 2019-02-18. *15–17 September - England v Hampshire XI - Artillery GroundEngland v Hampshire XI, scorecard, CricInfo. Retrieved 2019-02-18. James Aylward made his record score of 167 in the first England v Hampshire match of the season in June. This set a new record for the highest score in first-class cricket, surpassing the score of 136 made by John Small which had been made in 1775.Liverman D, Griffiths P (nd) From Minshull to Collins, CricInfo. Retrieved 2019-02-16. A printed bill reporting the match said that "Aylward went in at 5 o’clock on Wednesday afternoon, and was not out till after three on Friday" in making his score. The Hampshire total was 403 runs, with Tom Sueter scoring 46 runs, the second highest score in the innings. The match is known to have been played using three stumps, a voluntary measure which had been first introduced in 1775. Aylward's record stood until 1820, when it was beaten by William Ward. Three other matches are known to have been played during the season.Other matches in England 1777, CricketArchive. Retrieved 2019-02-10. ==Debutants== The following players made their first known appearance during the 1777 season. * William Bedster (Surrey and Middlesex) * Baker (Hampshire) * Robert Clifford (Kent) * Holness (Kent) * Lamborn (Surrey and Hampshire) * Noah Mann (Hampshire) * Pemmell (Kent) * Townsend (Kent) ==References== ==Further reading== * * * * * Category:1777 in English cricket Category:English cricket seasons from 1764 to 1786
title: 1777 English cricket season
